title: Formatting Bullets
content: Anyone have links to typographic rules. I get tired of explaining the proper way of formatting quotes, bullets, space after periods etc... only to be met with "well, I know that's how you like to do it, but..."
author: voiceof

comments.content: Ciferous, who do you have to explain that to ?

How do you want to format a bullet? A bullet is just one glyph, does it need formatting?

A.

Maybe voiceof means formatting bulleted text.

A good place to start is the list of [Books](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107162706/http:/typophile.com/node/12157) in the TypoWiki...

But here are a few I know...

[_The Elements of Typographic Style_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107162706/http:/www.amazon.com/Elements-Typographic-Style-Robert-Bringhurst/dp/0881792063/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1196286521&sr=1-1), by Robert Bringhurst

[_Type Rules!_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107162706/http:/www.amazon.com/Type-Rules-Designers-Professional-Typography/dp/047172114X/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1196286617&sr=1-1), by Ilene Strizver

[_Thinking with Type_](http://web.archive.org/web/20131107162706/http:/www.amazon.com/Thinking-Type-Critical-Designers-Students/dp/1568984480/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1196286641&sr=1-2), by Ellen Lupton
